message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.NI, cs.CC 

The paper deals with the construction of minimum storage regenerating (MSR) codes, which are used in distributed storage systems. This topic falls under the intersection of several computer science sub-fields, including information theory (cs.IT), distributed systems (cs.DS), signal processing (cs.SI), networked systems (cs.NI), and computer communication (cs.CC). Given that the paper focuses on the construction of codes for efficient repair of a single node, it is most likely to be classified under cs.IT and cs.DS. However, it also discusses the sub-packetization of codes, which is a topic in signal processing, and the bandwidth efficiency of repair, which is relevant to networked systems and computer communication.
